title: Is Jayson Tatum practicing with Celtics teammates? Latest social media post seems to indicate as much
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum practiced with Maine Celtics on February 10 after spending the season sidelined due to an Achilles tear.
Celtics' Instagram post shows Tatum practicing, suggesting potential return; photos from San Francisco workout indicate team scrimmages.
Celtics' March 1 home game flexed to 'Sunday Night Basketball,' sparking speculation of Tatum's return, but no official announcement.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC Sports broadcasters emphasized silence to accentuate key Olympic moments in Milan Cortina, enhancing the viewer experience.
Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko delivered detailed commentary on Team USA's gold medal win in women's hockey.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir allowed Alysa Liu's figure skating performance to shine with minimal dialogue.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston will fund free rides on MBTA bus routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using unspent federal funds.
The fare-free initiative, launched in March 2022, was extended twice using federal COVID-19 relief, costing $340,000 monthly.
Future funding beyond June is uncertain; discussions with MBTA and Gov. Healey's administration are ongoing.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported highest snow totals in Massachusetts, with 6.5 inches in Leyden as of 7 a.m. February 21.
Essex County saw significant snowfall, including 5 inches in Haverhill and 4.6 inches in Methuen by Saturday morning.
A new snowstorm with potential blizzard conditions is expected Sunday night into Monday, according to the National Weather Service.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of the 2013 bombing victims.
LaRosa has been inspired by her coworker Annie, who has completed the marathon 24 times, to achieve her dream.
The marathon is scheduled for April 20, 2026, marking a significant personal milestone for LaRosa.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac, 38, sentenced to 15 months in federal prison for wire fraud involving COVID relief funds.
Kirouac used $600,000 of $1M in Economic Injury Disaster Loans to buy a golf course in Hillsborough.
He fraudulently obtained loans through the CARES Act, misrepresenting their use, affecting multiple companies he owned.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, was charged with multiple counts of larceny, drug possession, and being a 'common and notorious thief'.
Alleged thefts occurred in November at Back Bay stores, including Lululemon and Ralph Lauren, totaling thousands in merchandise.
Cutelis, with a criminal history since 2001, is held on a separate fugitive charge from New Hampshire after failing to appear.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will remain the Red Sox leadoff hitter for the 2026 season, according to manager Alex Cora.
Anthony posted a .336 average with six home runs and 17 RBIs as a leadoff hitter last year.
Willson Contreras is set to hit cleanup, signaling a lineup balance with Trevor Story likely batting second.

title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price discusses her Massachusetts connection and inspirations, including Joan Baez, ahead of her Boston show.
Price's new album 'Hard Headed Woman' reflects her defiant stance in country music and is Grammy-nominated.
Her collaborations include performances with John Prine and covers of Bob Dylan and Woody Guthrie's works.

title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Jordan Whitaker, 25, runs the 2026 Boston Marathon for Mass. Eye and Ear, inspired by her daughter's healthcare experience.
Whitaker's daughter, treated at Mass. Eye and Ear, had infected cysts removed from her facial nerve, ensuring nerve function.
The surgery also addressed severe sleep apnea by removing tonsils and adenoids, improving her daughter's health and quality of life.
